body_html: Huh, so I just realized that libcuda.so on my system isn't where all other CUDA libs are, but in /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/, so it's picked up by the compiler automatically. @ngimel what's a reliable way to look for libcuda? Is it symlinked somewhere in the toolkit dir?

body: Huh, so I just realized that `libcuda.so` on my system isn't where all other CUDA libs are, but in `/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/`, so it's picked up by the compiler automatically. @ngimel what's a reliable way to look for `libcuda`? Is it symlinked somewhere in the toolkit dir?
